title: How to Make a Homemade Toaster Strudel Breakfast Pastry

steps.headline: Line a cookie sheet with parchment paper/wax paper.
Roll puff pastry dough onto a lightly floured surface until it is 1/3 of it's original size.
Cut this dough into rectangular pieces, so that you have at least eight rectangles of dough.
Whisk together the jam and cornstarch in a small bowl.
Spread 3 tsp jam into about the center of each rectangle.
steps.description: Save ⁄4 inch (0.6 cm) gap around the edges.

steps.headline: Fold these pastries from one end to the other.
Seal the pastry by cutting off any excess pastry dough.
Place pastries on a cookie sheet/baking sheet.
Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown.
Let them cool completely before serving.
Make the vanilla icing for the top of the toaster strudel, to top the item off with.

text: Preheat oven to 375 °F (191 °C).  Line a cookie sheet with parchment paper/wax paper.  Roll puff pastry dough onto a lightly floured surface until it is 1/3 of it's original size.  Cut this dough into rectangular pieces, so that you have at least eight rectangles of dough.  Whisk together the jam and cornstarch in a small bowl.  Spread 3 tsp jam into about the center of each rectangle. Save ⁄4 inch (0.6 cm) gap around the edges. Fold these pastries from one end to the other.  Seal the pastry by cutting off any excess pastry dough.  Place pastries on a cookie sheet/baking sheet.  Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown.  Let them cool completely before serving.  Make the vanilla icing for the top of the toaster strudel, to top the item off with.
